name: Sensei Jerald Carter
ranks: Modern Arnis — 1st Degree (under Guro Bruce Chiu)
summary: Sensei Carter blends Okinawan striking with SCJ joint‑control and Modern Arnis flow. He emphasizes safety, fundamentals, and respectful culture so students of all ages can progress.

name: Grandmaster Jack Hogan (1949–2017)
teachers: Collaborators & influences: Prof. Wally Jay (SCJ), GM Remy A. Presas (Modern Arnis), George Dillman (Kyusho)
summary: GM Hogan specialized in practical self‑defense and pressure‑point concepts, teaching internationally and shaping CMAI’s core approach to clean basics and courtesy.

name: Professor Wally Jay (1917–2011)
summary: Prof. Jay refined precision and leverage into Small Circle Jujitsu—principles that inform CMAI’s joint‑control and safety methods.

name: Professor Leon Jay
summary: Prof. Leon Jay continues SCJ worldwide; his seminars and mentorship reinforce tuite, structure, and safe practice at CMAI.

name: Guro Bruce Chiu
summary: A personal student of GM Remy Presas, Guro Bruce supports our Modern Arnis program—flow drills, disarms, and empty‑hand translations linked back to kata.
